TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F. Austin to Alexander Jackson, 03-01-1824

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin functioning as a clearing house.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 748

div1.p: Austin functioning as a clearing house.
Recd of Alexander Jackson two hundred and thirty one dollars and 75/100 in surveyors orders towards the payment of his League of land on Peach Creek in my colony in the Province of Texas
